Colin Powell thinks that America ''isn't quite post-racial'' at this time. ''These problems still exist in post-racial America.'' ( 2001-2006) during which he ran the Defense Department for President Bush - particularly since nearly two-thirds of the book deals with that relatively brief period in the author's life. But, as Donald Rumsfeld writes, he's never much of a handwringer, I don't spend a lot of time in recriminations, looking back or second-guessing decisions made in real time with imperfect information by myself or others.
